alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:50PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water On The Nenana the Delta and The Tanana Rivers This Week... High water on the Delta, Nenana Rivers and Tanana Rivers will continue for the next several days. The Tanana River has risen to bankfull from Delta Junction to Fairbanks. Minor flooding is possible in low lying areas along the Tanana River such as the boat landing at Whitestone Farms near Delta Junction, and the Perkins Landing area near Fairbanks. Flooding is possible on the Nenana River near the City of Nenana. Small rivers and creeks in the Denali Park area could see minor flooding through Tuesday as well. Heavy rain that fell over the South Slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to Isabell Pass the past several days has caused this high water. Another round of heavy rain is expected over the South Slopes of The Alaska Range today through Wed. This could cause the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers to continue rising this week, and cause rivers in the Denali area to remain high of possibly flood. Mud and rock slides are possible in along South Slopes of the Alaska Range between Isabell Pass and Denali through Wednesday as well.
